description: Least common multiple of all (k+1)'s, where the k's are the positive divisors of n.
comments: a(n) is a divisor of A020696(n). - _Ivan Neretin_, May 27 2015
links: Carl R. White, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Since the positive divisors of 6 are 1, 2, 3 and 6, a(6) = LCM(1+1,2+1,3+1,6+1) = LCM(2,3,4,7) = 84.
mathematica: a057643[n_Integer] := Apply[LCM, Map[# + 1 &, Divisors[n]]]; Table[a057643[n], {n, 10000}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 19 2014 *)
author: _Leroy Quet_, Oct 11 2000
